text: any downsides to having a menu in HubSpot controlled via a custom module (mega menu, icons, etc) vs hardcoding that into a hs menu and then parsing out the icon css etc inside the menu?
make your header a global partial and add your menu module in there as a global module.
Not really, we do that with the boilerplate. It’s a HubSpot menu, we’re just not using the default menu module or menu tag.

If you’re saying use fields instead of a menu, that’s a little different.

My recommendation would then be to build your module in such a way that you can still leverage the HubSpot menu field functionality, but if you need to use things like icons etc, you could create a repeater, and basically provide a way of selecting the links to apply things to. Such as an icon or visual style
is that just for css / js already there and all the funtionality?
to be clear I’m saying you’d use the menu field. The field doesn’t come with any CSS/JS. It’s just a better UI for creating a menu, and you don’t have the 4 levels of depth limitation groups do.

for when you review later. Here’s what we do in the boilerplate:
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src/modules/menu-section.module>
